page.title: 01Introduction - Horsmonden
page.content: Our area consists of the village of Horsmonden and surrounding farms and countryside. It has several shops, three smallish factories, a primary school and two doctors surgeries. There is one large housing estate and three smaller ones. There are three public houses, one of which used to be a Coaching inn. Horsmonden stands on the by-road that joins Tunbridge Wells to Cranbrook. The population is about 1900. Horsmonden has three churches, a Roman Catholic, a Methodist and a Church of England. The Anglican church is called St Margaret's and is two miles South of the village. The village was built round the iron industry centred at the Furnace Pond, half a mile to the North-West, where they cooled the iron. The River Teise runs though our area and later joins the Medway.
